claim.text: Buffalo, New York eliminated citywide parking minimums in 2017
claim.claim: Buffalo, NY eliminated citywide parking minimums in 2017

results.summary: Buffalo, NY did eliminate citywide parking minimums in 2017, becoming the first major American city to do so.
results.detail: Buffalo, New York eliminated its parking minimums as part of a comprehensive zoning code overhaul called the Green Code, which was adopted in 2016 and took effect in early 2017. The city removed minimum parking requirements citywide, replacing them with parking maximums in some areas. This was widely reported as a landmark decision making Buffalo the first major U.S. city to completely eliminate parking minimums.
sources: Strong Towns coverage of Buffalo Green Code

results.summary: Minneapolis did eliminate parking minimums in 2021 as part of broader zoning reforms.
results.detail: Based on my training data, Minneapolis eliminated citywide parking minimums in November 2021. This was part of the Minneapolis 2040 comprehensive plan implementation, making it one of the first major U.S. cities to do so citywide after smaller cities like Buffalo, NY pioneered the policy. The City Council approved the elimination of minimum parking requirements for new developments.
sources: Training knowledge - unable to verify with live web search due to permissions

claim.text: The structural capacity is usually adequate — parking loads exceed residential loads
claim.claim: Parking structure loads exceed residential loads

results.summary: Parking structures are designed for higher live loads than residential buildings per standard building codes.
results.detail: According to ASCE 7 (Minimum Design Loads for Buildings) and the International Building Code (IBC), parking garages are typically designed for live loads of 40 psf for passenger vehicles, while residential buildings are designed for 30-40 psf live loads (30 psf for sleeping areas, 40 psf for other areas). Additionally, parking structures must account for concentrated wheel loads and impact factors. This is well-established in structural engineering practice and building codes.
sources: ASCE 7-22 Minimum Design Loads and Associated Criteria for Buildings and Other Structures
